Posts.Content: vicky3blum wrote: i had my BMS on feb 27.  this board has been so helpful. we just rented out our home because we cannot afford the mortgage but that was okay because we bought a camper to live in the mountains in a nudist resort where we have been members for many years. they have given emotional support all these years for my seriously ill son and now for me with the bc.  we are supposed to move there on saturday. we have been saying thank god for the place because of the support and it sure beats living under a bridge and i also make money running the ice cream shop.  nowit is surrounded by fire, 2 people have died, alot of animals have already died and there is zero containment. please pray. vicky Dx 1/20/2012, IDC, ER+/PR- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2012 12:09AM vicky3blum wrote: I'm sure you have nothing to worry about BUT my surgeon never ordered an oncotype before my bmx.  When I first went to see my oncologist he decided to order one at that time.  He assured me that everything they needed for the test had been saved.  I could not help but envision a freezer [chest of course] filled with saran wrapped, snowball shaped boobs. weird, huh?
Posts.Title: A bit OT, post-BMX question mary625 mary625

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2012 01:59PM vicky3blum wrote: my son has a delilibating neurological condition.  they believe it is related to his tourettes [which is always related to some form of brain damage]  his brain signals to his body that his nerves are under accute attack.  he has had months on end where he would pass out hundreds of times a day from the pain.  accupuncture sometimes controlled it a bit.  we tried everything, even goingoutside the country, spending every dime we had and then some.   then we tried mmj [ my son was second minor in state to receive the pink card] that helped alot for about 3 years but then stopped helping.  every day he was begging me to help him die.  anyway, after alot of online research, i asked the doctor about nortryptaline .  probablt it has already been mentioned in this thread, but thought i would mention it just in case. it is actually an anti-depressant. since taking it my son's pains have reduced 80 to 90 percent.  has anyone tried this. for us it has been no less than a miracle[ of course we start planning on a somewhat normal life for him and 2 weeks later i get BC. and we wind up homeless.[ we will have a place to stay but we will miss our home of the past 12 years]  I keep trying to remind myself that if things turn out well after my mastectomy and my son keeps doing alright, everything else is just a piece of cake.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2012 11:22PM vicky3blum wrote: I had my BMX on february 27th. Because I gained 15 pounds as soon as I found out I had cancer[ watched too many people with cancer waste away] my 36DD bras were too small for me.  During my BMXmthe psput in TE's.  After 2 fills I am already at 450 cc's.  <m nipples, aerola and a large ammount of skin was removed along with my breasts and the cancer.. some skin, not a lot was left. the skin will actually be stimulated to grow, my 57 year old diabetic body is having no problems with this.  My next fill will be friday but that is only to overexpand beccause I am happier at my age with the slightly smaller chest. I'm still a full c, small d but I am sure I would have no difficulty getting larger. i have simply chosen otherwise.  BTW, you are not being shallow.  You hav a right to have as much as has been taken away from you as possible.
